result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Smith II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
60 days as straight time and the remainder with Huber release for work, job search and/or education.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Absolute sobriety.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.

No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.

Comply with all rules of probation and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
Cooperate with agent.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (unless previously done).
Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
Pay supervision fees.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at $0.00.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony L Smith II in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Anthony L Smith II.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 : Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 5 DAYS served, 60 days as straight time and the remainder with Huber release for work, job search and/or education. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2 : Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.
- Comply with all rules of probation and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to contact probation immediately.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Character Letter from Danielle Smith, filed.
Character Letter from Briana Moore, filed.
Character letter from Kontrell Givens, filed.
/from Attorney Gregory Rothstein dated 10/13/202, memo for sentencing hearing, filed.

Defendant Anthony L Smith II in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Anthony L Smith II.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L Smith in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pretrial conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State, and requests additional time to review.  
Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Adjourned Pre-trial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Smith in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/01/2022 as the deadline for the State to confirm all discovery, wtih the exception of crime lab reports, is turned over to the defense. Court sets 08/08/2022 as the deadline for filing motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Anthony L Smith in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Anthony L Smith in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received and Filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony L Smith not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/19/22 @ 1:30p
